comments:
This class is an intensive beginning Chinese class for students who have had some exposure to Mandarin but are not ready to move on to the intermediate level. The two-credit class meets twice a week for 1.5 hours and three times a week for 2 hours.
Students believed this course to be best for any “non-native person interesting in learning Chinese.” The class integrated oral, written, and reading skills evenly. Students warned that the class moved at a very fast pace, with frequent quizzes, in-class writing, and individual tutorials. However, students reported learning a lot and claimed to have never been overwhelmed. They also felt that “course organization was great for mastering beginning Chinese in such a short period of time”.
There were only positive remarks about Professors Lee for the professor “really cares” about the students and worked hard to communicate the material. It was suggested that the professor discourage the speaking of English in the classroom so that the course could be taught entirely in Chinese.
Students highly recommended this course and called it a very positive experience. They left feeling more “confident in [their] Chinese abilities.”
